channel.title: Joe's Truffles
channel.description: An RSS representation of Joe's Truffle feed

item.description:
Comment: Been finishing the leftovers since our game night on Saturday. Added a full pound of gruyere!

Soup: Butternut squash with Gruyere

Comment: Was listening to this podcast last night and heard Kevin ask the question as to whether the album was really 90's. Given how many times I listened to it in the 90's, I'd have to say 'yes'.

Podcast: Good Christian Fun

Artist: Jars of Clay

Album: Much Afraid

Comment: Spent a lovely morning here with a cup of tea!

Location: 30.2188583,-97.7979541

Place name: Full English

Comment: Been drinking a lot of this, this not-quite-holiday season.

Tea: Twinings Green Tea (Jasmine)
Comment: What do drag queens and software development have to do with each other? Let's find out!

Comment: Found a copy of this taped up on the wall of the office. Great stuff!

Tweet: https://twitter.com/jennschiffer/status/600109116019838976

Tweet content: psa: all of your code is ephemeral & will one day not even matter. it probably doesn't even matter now. how you treat your peers matters ðŸ’«

Twitter handle: @jennschiffer

Comment: I voted today!

Approximate wait time: 30 minutes

Voted: true

Comment: Since Monday, we've been under a boil order. It hasn't been the most convenient thing, but it's certainly a good reminder that we need to protect our natural resources.

City: Austin

Comment: I don't have enough time for more TV, podcasts, books, or anything else. Thank you.

Full: true

Comment: This is the first day of actual autumn in Austin.

Temperature: 7ÂºC
Comment: I've had an idea for an open-source project that Truffle has inspired. Keep finding myself short on time to write it. Maybe I could repurpose NaNoWriMo to do it?

Comment: Had a wonderful breakfast taco here. Instead of hashbrown-style potatoes, they do a pierogi style filling!

Place name: K C Donut Store

Comment: I got a haircut a week ago and forgot to write a truffle, so here's one.

Haircut: true

Comment: Was inspired by seeing some recipes elsewhere online. Dressing ingredients are to taste, based on half of a lime.

Recipe name: Thai-style beef salad

Recipe: This is designed to use leftover beef from a London Broil. Slice your meat across the grain and set it aside. Slice the cabbage as thinly as possible and put it in a bowl with the other ingredients except salad greens. Mix well, then stir in the beef. Serve the beef/cabbage mixture over greens.

Ingredients:

  • Leftover London Broil, refrigerated
  • Salad greens
  • Red cabbage
  • Green onion
  • Fish sauce
  • Sweet chili sauce
  • Fresh cilantro, chopped finely
  • Juice from half of a lime

Comment: We got a couple of new pieces today. It's surprising how they can change the entire feel of the space!

Furniture:

  • Couch
  • Loveseat
Comment: Lots of rain lately has given me a case of the blahs, but I'm definitely thankful it's here after a long, hot summer.

Comment: For the second time in a row, I put my deglazer in before the flour. Oops.

Food: Gravy

Comment: Froyo night!

Place name: Yoway

Comment: Been using this to simultaneously explore PostgreSQL and GraphQL.

Software: PostGraphile

Link: https://github.com/graphile/postgraphile

Comment: Eating store-brand thin mints, which reminds me of this, which is basically thin mint paste.

Food: Chocolate mint dessert hummus
